problem.markdown:
>>The moment of inertia is:<< (x) a function of the cross-sectional shape and size. ( ) a function of the length of the beam. ( ) a function of the material of the beam. ( ) a function of the supports of the beam.
[explanation] The moment of inertia is a function of the shape and size of the cross-section of the beam. The bigger the cross-section, the higher the moment of inertia. The further the mass of the cross-section is from the center, the higher the moment of inertia. [explanation]
